title: Social implications of Buddhism for South Asia

content.prompt: Which of the following was the main reason that Buddhist thought had important social implications for South Asia?

choices.label: Its followers were incorporated into the Brahman caste.
It reinforced the idea of obedience to the emperor as a means to salvation.
